topics.name: Physical Quantities and Measurement Techniques
topics.description: Introduces measurement methods (ruler, caliper, stopwatch), scalar vs vector quantities, and graphical interpretation of data.

topics.name: Motion
topics.description: Covers speed, velocity, acceleration, equations of motion, and interpretation of distance‑time and velocity‑time graphs.

topics.name: Mass and Weight
topics.description: Explains the difference between mass and weight, measurement methods, gravitational field strength, and the relation W = m g.

topics.name: Density
topics.description: Defines density, how to determine density experimentally, and its applications in buoyancy and material identification.

topics.name: Forces
topics.description: Introduces types of forces (contact and non‑contact), Newton’s laws, resultant forces, friction, and tension.

topics.name: Momentum
topics.description: Covers impulse, linear momentum, and conservation of momentum in collisions and interactions.

topics.name: Energy, Work and Power
topics.description: Explores energy stores, work done, power, efficiency, and energy transfer calculations.

topics.name: Pressure
topics.description: Examines pressure in solids and fluids, including calculations, atmospheric pressure, and applications like hydraulic systems.

topics.name: Kinetic Particle Model of Matter
topics.description: Introduces the particle model in solids, liquids, and gases and links microscopic motion to macroscopic properties.

topics.name: Thermal Properties and Temperature
topics.description: Discusses temperature, heat capacity, specific heat, latent heat, and their measurement and applications.

topics.name: Transfer of Thermal Energy
topics.description: Covers conduction, convection and radiation of heat, including insulation and the greenhouse effect.

topics.name: General Properties of Waves
topics.description: Defines waves, wavelength, frequency, amplitude, wave speed and behaviours like reflection, refraction and diffraction.

topics.name: Light
topics.description: Explores properties of light, reflection and refraction in mirrors and lenses, and how optical instruments work.

topics.name: Electromagnetic Spectrum
topics.description: Covers the EM spectrum, properties and uses of different bands (radio, microwave, IR, UV, X‑ray, gamma).

topics.name: Sound
topics.description: Examines production, transmission and detection of sound, speed of sound in different media, and acoustic applications.

topics.name: Simple Phenomena of Magnetism
topics.description: Looks at magnetic fields, attraction/repulsion, Earth’s magnetism, and behaviour of simple magnets.

topics.name: Electrical Quantities
topics.description: Introduces electric charge, current, voltage, resistance, and the relationships between them (Ohm’s Law).

topics.name: Electric Circuits
topics.description: Analyzes series and parallel circuits, circuit diagrams, and calculations involving current, voltage and resistance.

topics.name: Electrical Safety
topics.description: Covers precautions and practical safety measures in electrical work, including fuses, earthing, and circuit protection.

topics.name: Electromagnetic Effects
topics.description: Explores magnetic fields around currents, electromagnetic induction, and the operation of motors and generators.

topics.name: Nuclear Model of the Atom
topics.description: Outlines the structure of the atom, including protons, neutrons, electrons and concepts of isotopes.

topics.name: Radioactivity
topics.description: Covers types of radiation (alpha, beta, gamma), decay, half‑life, and applications and safety of nuclear radiation.

topics.name: Earth and the Solar System
topics.description: Investigates the Earth–Moon–Sun system, orbits, eclipses, seasons, and basic calculations using the speed of light.

topics.name: Stars and the Universe
topics.description: Explores star formation, life cycles, H-R diagrams, galaxies, Big Bang theory, redshift and cosmology.
